SVGFEDiffuseLightingElement.summary: The SVGFEDiffuseLightingElement interface corresponds to the feDiffuseLighting element.

SVGFEDiffuseLightingElementWidth.summary: The width read-only property of the interface describes the horizontal size of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the feDiffuseLighting element's {{SVGAttr("width")}} filter primitive attribute. The filter lights an image using the alpha channel as a bump map. The attribute is a <length> or a <percentage> relative to the width of the filter region. The default value is 100%. The property value is a length in user coordinate system units.

SVGFEDiffuseLightingElementX.summary: The x read-only property of the interface describes the horizontal coordinate of the position of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the feDiffuseLighting element's {{SVGAttr("x")}} filter primitive attribute value. The filter lights an image using the alpha channel as a bump map. The attribute is a <length> or <percentage>. The <coordinate> is a length in the user coordinate system that is the given distance from the origin of the user coordinate system along the x-axis. If the x attribute is a percent value, the property value is relative to the width of the filter region in user coordinate system units. The default value is 0.

SVGFEDiffuseLightingElementDiffuseConsta.summary: The diffuseConstant read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("diffuseConstant")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feDiffuseLighting")}} element.

SVGFEDiffuseLightingElementHeight.summary: The height read-only property of the interface describes the vertical size of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the feDiffuseLighting element's {{SVGAttr("height")}} filter primitive attribute. The filter lights an image using the alpha channel as a bump map. The attribute is a <length> or a <percentage> relative to the height of the filter region. The default value is 100%. The property value is a length in user coordinate system units.

SVGFEDiffuseLightingElementKernelUnitLen.summary: The kernelUnitLengthY read-only property of the interface reflects the Y component of the {{SVGAttr("kernelUnitLength")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feDiffuseLighting")}} element.
The kernelUnitLengthX read-only property of the interface reflects the X component of the {{SVGAttr("kernelUnitLength")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feDiffuseLighting")}} element.

SVGFEDiffuseLightingElementResult.summary: The result read-only property of the interface describes the assigned name of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the {{SVGElement("feDiffuseLighting")}} element's {{SVGAttr("result")}} attribute. The filter lights an image using the alpha channel as a bump map. The attribute value is a custom-ident. If supplied, then graphics that result from processing this filter primitive can be referenced by an {{SVGAttr("in")}} attribute on a subsequent filter primitive within the same {{SVGElement("filter")}} element.

If no result attribute is defined, the filter's result.baseVal and result.animVal are empty strings, and the output of the <feDiffuseLighting> filter will only be available for re-use as the implicit input into the next filter primitive if that filter primitive provides no value for its in attribute.

-
-custom-ident data type
-
-feSpecularLighting
-CSS blend-mode data type
-CSS mix-blend-mode property

SVGFEDiffuseLightingElementIn1.summary: The in1 read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("in")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feDiffuseLighting")}} element.

SVGFEDiffuseLightingElementSurfaceScale.summary: The surfaceScale read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("surfaceScale")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feDiffuseLighting")}} element.

SVGFEDiffuseLightingElementY.summary: The y read-only property of the interface describes the vertical coordinate of the position of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the feDiffuseLighting element's {{SVGAttr("y")}} filter primitive attribute value. The filter lights an image using the alpha channel as a bump map. The attribute is a <length> or <percentage>. The <coordinate> is a length in the user coordinate system that is the given distance from the origin of the filter along the y-axis. If the y attribute is a percent value, the property value is a relative to the height of the filter region in user coordinate system units. The default value is 0.
